name: The Personalized Video
description: Eric Nowoslawski's video-first approach. Record a personalized Loom showing their website, product, or data. The email is just the wrapper to get them to watch.
guidelines: The video is the value—the email is just the intro
Show THEIR website/product in the video, not a generic demo
Include bullet points previewing the content

examples.context: Web developer sending a personalized site audit video
examples.subject: 60 second review
examples.body:
Sarah - made a quick video walking through Grove's homepage: [Video thumbnail]

In 60 seconds, I cover:
- Why your hero section isn't converting (and a quick fix)
- A mobile UX issue I spotted
- One thing you're doing really well

No pitch—just observations. Worth a watch if you have a minute.
examples.whyItWorks: Personalized video preview, clear bullet points, no pitch

examples.context: Sales trainer sending a rep's call review
examples.subject: reviewed a call
examples.body:
Amanda - found one of your rep's cold calls on YouTube (they recorded it for training).

[Video thumbnail]

Recorded 90 seconds of coaching notes—what they did well and two changes that could boost their connect rate.

Figured you might want to see it. No obligation.
examples.whyItWorks: Reviewed their actual content, video provides immediate value

examples.context: Conversion optimizer sending a UX teardown
examples.subject: watched myself signup
examples.body:
Marcus - [Video thumbnail]

Recorded my screen going through Apex's trial signup. Found 3 friction points probably costing you 20-30% of potential signups.

Video is 2 minutes—I narrate exactly what I'm thinking as a first-time user.

Might be useful to see how someone experiences your flow with no context.
examples.whyItWorks: First-person UX experience, quantified potential impact

promptTemplate:
You are writing a cold email using 'The Personalized Video' approach.

CORE PRINCIPLE: The video IS the value. The email just gets them to click play.

STRUCTURE:
1. HOOK: Brief context about why you made the video
2. VIDEO: Mention with [Video thumbnail] placeholder
3. PREVIEW: Bullet what they'll learn/see
4. SOFT CTA: No pressure, just invitation to watch

RULES:
- Keep email under 75 words
- Include 2-3 bullet points previewing content
- Use [Video thumbnail] as placeholder
- Subject line: 1-4 words
